title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION IN CRISIS AFFECTED COMM

description.narrative: Crisis-affected girls and boys are protected from abuse, violence and exploitation, and thrive in supportive families and communities, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls, boys, families and communities assessed with humanitarian needs due to crisis have access to goods and services in education, nutrition & health, child protection, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and social protection to save lives and assist recovery through proven cost-effective participatory interventions focused on the rights of the child, and equity and gender considerations.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Services to prevent or respond to gender-based violence in emergencies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
